levels.details: The Chronos process has been restored to normal operation.
levels.cause: The Chronos process has been restored to normal operation. The previously issued alarm has been cleared.
levels.effect: This Chronos process is providing full service again. If this alarm is clear on all nodes running Chronos then fully redundant timer operation has been restored.

levels.details: Monit has detected that the Chronos process has failed. A restart will automatically be attempted. If this alarm does not clear, the Chronos process may have been stopped or an unrecoverable failure may have occurred.
levels.cause: The system has detected that the Chronos process has failed.
levels.effect: The Chronos cluster has lost some redundancy of timer operations but can still operate normally. This alarm is not service affecting.
levels.action: Monitor for this alarm to clear. If this alarm does not clear then contact your support representative.

levels.details: The local Chronos process is synchronized with the rest of the cluster. Chronos resynchronization is no longer blocking a scale-in or scale-out operation (a different database resynchronization operation may still be in progress though).
levels.cause: The local Chronos process is synchronized with the rest of the cluster. Chronos resynchronization is no longer blocking a scale-in or scale-out operation (other databases may still be re-synchronizing). This alarm is caused by the clearing of a previously issued alarm for adding nodes to deployment.
levels.effect: The Chronos node being added has completed clustering and will be operational once all clustering and shared config alarms have cleared and the node has been added to DNS.
levels.action: No action. The user can continue with any scaling operations (e.g. add the node to DNS or turn it down).

levels.details: The local Chronos process is resynchronizing with the rest of the cluster. Service should be unaffected. If a scale-in or scale-out operation is in progress, wait for resynchronization to finish before completing the operation.
levels.description: Chronos: Chronos database resynchronization in progress
levels.cause: The local Chronos process is resynchronizing with the rest of the cluster. This alarm is caused by adding or removing nodes to a deployment, or when this Chronos process starts up.
levels.action: If a scale-in or scale-out operation is in progress, wait for resynchronization to finish before completing the operation.
